title: Oregon Caves National Monument & Preserve: Freedom Of Information Act
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Freedom Of Information Act              Freedom Of Information Act       If you require information from Oregon Caves National Monument, the U.S. Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) ensures public access to U.S. government records. Upon written request, the monument is required to disclose those records, unless they can be lawfully withheld from disclosure due to exemptions in the FOIA. This right of access is ultimately enforceable in federal court. If you desire information from Oregon Caves National Monument, contact the monument. For more information on the Freedom of Information Act, visit: United States Department of Justice, FOIA Federal Bureau of Investigation, FOIA
